               18331

footnotes.text: 1David Dickinson wrote the body of the text. Lincoln signed his own name only.
3Sinco may have owed money to the New Salem tavern that Alley owned and operated.

4WhenLincolnlived in New Salem, he appraised property on at least three occasions, including
                  this one. The other two occasions involved the value of horses instead of land.Lincoln et al. appraised property for Sangamon County Circuit Court, Martha L. Benner and Cullom Davis et al., eds.,The Law Practice of Abraham Lincoln: Complete Documentary Edition, 2d edition Springfield: Illinois Historic Preservation Agency, 2009,http://www.lawpracticeofabrahamlincoln.org/Details.aspx?case=141375;Lincoln & Reed appraised property for Brown, Martha L.
